incident_updates.body:
In an efforts to continuously dogfood the Router before getting it into customer hands, we rolled a release of the Router out into production. After seeing things being stable in our testing, we rolled this out more broadly and saw issues underlying the changes themselves. We immediately switched traffic off of the test and back to our baseline pods to resolve the customer impact.

We apologize for the outage, and as always appreciate your patience.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

The upstream incident appears to be reaching a resolution, and GitHub reports it is continuing to monitor as things return to stability. Installations for both Rover and router should now be working as expected and GitHub updates triggered via GraphOS should start to come in. No user action should be required!

GitHub is currently experiencing a widespread outage (see https://www.githubstatus.com/incidents/c8zjb9351hlc) which affects the CDN distribution for installers for Rover and router. Additionally, the Apollo GitHub bot for usage with schema checks may be unable to make comments or status updates on pull requests.

incidents.name: Default Router communication to AWS Uplink degraded

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

On March 15th, at 9:01 AM Pacific, Apollo performed maintenance on our AWS Uplink configuration delivery system. The change was to migrate our internal loadbalancers to best practice Edge optimized routing.

In doing so, we removed a route used by default Routers, thus making their fallback to AWS fail with a 4XX.

From our observations of our systems, this impacted some of our traffic but with our knowledge of our rates of success/failure with our GCP Uplink, we do not believe any Routers running in our customer's systems were critically impacted.

No Apollo Gateways were impacted by this change at all.

On March 23rd, at around 2:30 PM Pacific, we patched this issue and confirmed seeing our 4XX error rate drop back to almost 0%.

We apologize for any inconvenience this caused by this escaped bug, and will be working in the coming days on our postmortem. As always, we appreciate your patience!

components.name: Uplink
components.description: Studio managed Supergraph Schema Delivery. Apollo Gateway (v 0.34+) uses Uplink to fetch routing configuration dynamically from the Apollo schema registry.

incident_updates.body: Studio UI was fully degraded at 4:26 PM EST and recovered at 4:48 PM EST. Other platform services such as Checks were unaffected.
This incident has been resolved.

Between February 16th, at 21:24 UTC and February 22nd at 18:52 UTC, Apollo had a bug in our GCS Schema Delivery Pipeline.

To be impacted by this bug, customers would need to:

- Be on an Apollo Gateway version before 0.45.0, and have their Gateway set to receive SuperGraph configuration via GCS
    - NOTE: In Apollo Gateway version 0.34.0 we changed SuperGraph delivery to default to Uplink
- Be on Federation version 1.0
- Make a change to a Subgraph URL but NOT make a change to their Subgraph's schema

If you believe you fall into the above camp, you will be able to resolve this issue on your end by making any deployment whatsoever to the variant in question.

Please reach out to support for any further questions.

incidents.name: Cloud Router Serverless offering experiencing inconsistent availability

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved. We haven't observed any more network connectivity problems with our upstream vendor.
We are continuing to monitor for further issues.
We are continuing to monitor for further issues.
We are continuing to monitor for further issues.
We are continuing to monitor for further issues.
We are continuing to monitor for further issues.
We are continuing to monitor for further issues.
We are continuing to monitor for further issues.

We have been able to confirm that all "impacted" Serverless Cloud Routers will have at worst a few milliseconds of latency added to their routing. Having this impact is also highly improbable, but definitely possible.

At this time we are quickly moving to fix the final impacted Serverless Cloud Routers, but are reducing the severity of this incident as we have been able to confirm the scope is not dramatically hampering most traffic.

We have gotten an update from our upstream vendor and all new Cloud Routers on the Serverless offering will not be impacted here. Additionally, we have been given steps to mitigate all impacted Serverless Cloud Routers, and will be moving forward with this process shortly.

Our upstream vendor appears to be having network connectivity problems which are impacting particular hosts in a particular region.  It does not impact all hosts in the impacted region and we are currently awaiting resolution or mitigation with our upstream vendor.

Some user's Cloud Routers on the Serverless offering are failing to come online.  Additionally, some existing deployments may have disrupted or intermittent network connectivity.  We are investigating with our upstream partner to determine the source of the outage.  We will post additional updates as soon as possible.

incidents.name: Failure to Load Graph List in Studio

incident_updates.body: For approximately 1 hour Studio may have been unable to fetch an organization's list of graphs from our back end services. We reverted the bad change, and have since fixed the underlying issue.  We apologize for any interruption this may have caused.

Checks and Launches were delayed from 2:15-2:45 PM EST due to an issue where our federation pipeline was deployed out of order. We have since resolved the deploy order issue and systems should be functional. If you have any questions, please reach out to our support team.

As always, we appreciate your patience.

incidents.name: Metrics Ingestion and Schema Checks Delayed

incident_updates.body:
We have observed no issues while monitoring, and we believe this incident to be resolved. If you have any questions, please reach out to our support team.

As always, we appreciate your patience.
Our metrics ingestion lag has recovered, and our operations check data storage system latency is no longer elevated. We are continuing to monitor our systems for further discrepancies.

We've determined that while the storage system service was non-functional, our metrics ingestion lag also increased. This lag has been recovering since we implemented the fix, and continues to recover.

We believe the delay is due to increased latency in our operations check data storage system, due to an issue in one of the constituent services. We have fixed the issue with the constituent service, and the storage system is recovering.
We are currently investigating an issue with schema checks being delayed. We are currently investigating to understand the scope of the degradation.

incident_updates.body:
Everything has been returned to normal. Downstream lag from our surge of ingesting metrics reports also seems caught up.

The impact to customers here would be that you would see your metrics reports posts having a 500. In Apollo Server, this is a background thread and should be retried, with no traffic impact, and no data loss.

As always, we appreciate the patience
A fix has been rolled out to resolve this issue. We are seeing our ingestion return to our normal levels. We will leave this open for 15 minutes to insure this is actually resolved for everyone.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are currently investigating an issue with our Kubernetes routing where our Metrics Ingress has no healthy pods to be able to serve traffic.

components.name: Metrics Ingestion
components.description: The metrics ingestion pipeline that Servers and Gateways report to, enabling support of Studio analytics and features.

incident_updates.body: Metrics Ingestion has gone back to normal levels and all systems are working as expected.
Our systems have scaled and recovered and are now stable. We continue to monitor Metrics Ingestion closely.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

We saw an elevated number of errors in talking with our Metrics Ingestion API from 12:18PM - 12:24PM (PDT). Our systems have scaled and recovered and are now stable. We continue to monitor Metrics Ingestion closely.

incidents.name: Elevated Error Rate for Apollo Platform API

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

From 11:55am PST - 12:25pm PST users of Rover v0.9.0+ and customers querying the Apollo Platform API directly without client identifying headers faced 500 error response codes. The issue causing this elevated error rate has been resolved. Please retry any failed CI/CD processes. Thank you for your patience and our apologies for the inconvenience.

incident_updates.body: The Cloud Routers that were affected had been deleted by our users and not cleaned up, which threw alerts during our update task.  All traffic for running Cloud Routers was still served during this period and new Cloud Routers were able to be created, so this was a bug in our monitoring and had no real user impact.  Thanks for your patience with this new product!
We are continuing to investigate the issue and will have another update in 30 minutes or less.

We are currently investigating an incident which prevents some previously-deployed Cloud Routers from being accessed.  Newly created Cloud Router deployments are working correctly.   We will provide more updates as soon as they are available.

components.name: Cloud Routing
components.description: GraphOS Cloud supergraphs hosted on Apollo infrastructure

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We have identified the issue and we have implemented a fix. Users should be able to create new accounts in Studio-UI, and utilize public variants now. We again appreciate your patience while we awaited resolution of this matter.
Public variants are also inaccessible at the moment. We apologize for the inconvenience, and we are working quickly to identify the issue.

We are currently experiencing an incident where new account creations in Studio-UI are failing. We are investigating the issue and we will be sharing updates. Existing accounts are not affected, and you can continue to authenticate with existing accounts. We want to thank you for your patience and sincerest apologies to anyone who is currently effected.

components.name: Studio UI
components.description: The Studio SaaS Frontend UI.

incident_updates.body: Our connection with our vendor for deploying new cloud routers was erroring for ~7 hours starting at 1am UTC on 11/1.  This has since been resolved, and many thanks for your patience!
We have seen our success rate return to
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
We are seeing our success in our metrics ingestion trending back. At this time we are observing our fixes and double checking metrics on our end.
We've identified our core issues and are working to resolve. At this time we are seeing increased success rates for our clients and are working to get back to 100%.
We are continuing to investigate this issue, we are upgrading this to a partial outage.
We are currently seeing an elevated number of 5XX errors in talking with our Metrics Ingestion API. We are investigating the root cause of this.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
At this time we are seeing requests having returned to normal and are now observing our status.
We are seeing numbers trending in the right direction. We are still working to resolve this issue fully.
We are seeing high latency in our GraphQL API, we are investigating the root cause of this issue.

incidents.name: Metrics reporting API experiencing high latency and errors

incident_updates.body: We've seen our ingestion reporting stable operational aspects for the last little while. As such, we're closing this out. Thanks for the patience folks!

We have identified the issue, and our metrics reporting endpoint should be functional at this time. Metrics and trace data may have been lost from 6:45AM-7AM PT. We are currently monitoring for further issues.

Our reporting endpoint is completely down and returning 5XXs at this time. There is likely metrics loss, and we are currently investigating.

It's possible your Apollo Server or Apollo Gateway instances may have increased memory usage at this time due to buffering metrics and trace data. If this is causing your fleet to run out of memory/crash, we recommend disabling the usage reporting plugin at this time. You can find guidance on this at https://www.apollographql.com/docs/apollo-server/v3/api/plugin/usage-reporting#disabling-the-plugin
